intro: Hieracium legnograptum, commonly known as the wood-grained hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium legnograptum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
